keyMoments.title: McKinley Arrives to Enforce Heaven's Judgment
keyMoments.description: McKinley, as Captain of the White Berets, arrives at Angel Beach to arrest the Straw Hat Pirates for their illegal entry into Skypiea.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces McKinley as the law enforcement leader of Skypiea and escalates the conflict with the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.quote: We are here to bestow Heaven's Judgment upon you.

keyMoments.title: McKinley Attacked by Nami
keyMoments.description: After explaining the fine, McKinley is attacked by an angry Nami who drives her Waver into his face.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates McKinley's vulnerability and escalates the Straw Hats' crime from Class 11 to Class 5.

keyMoments.title: McKinley Declares Class 2 Criminal Status
keyMoments.description: Despite being defeated, McKinley warns that the Straw Hats are now Class 2 criminals who will face judgment by the Priests.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the trials the Straw Hats must face and shows McKinley's dedication to his duty even in defeat.
keyMoments.quote: You are now Class 2 criminals. You will be judged by the Priests of Upper Yard!

reveals.information: Captain of the White Berets, Skypiea's police force

keyMoments.title: Ohm Introduced as One of Four Priests
keyMoments.description: Ohm appears alongside the other three priests while chasing an illegal treasure hunter through Upper Yard.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of one of the four main antagonists of the Skypiea trials.

reveals.information: One of God Enel's four priests

keyMoments.title: Satori Introduced as One of Four Priests
keyMoments.description: Satori appears alongside the other three priests while chasing an illegal treasure hunter through Upper Yard.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of one of the four main antagonists of the Skypiea trials.

reveals.information: One of God Enel's four priests

keyMoments.title: Shura Introduced as One of Four Priests
keyMoments.description: Shura appears alongside the other three priests while chasing an illegal treasure hunter through Upper Yard.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of one of the four main antagonists of the Skypiea trials.

reveals.information: One of God Enel's four priests

keyMoments.title: Gedatsu Introduced as One of Four Priests
keyMoments.description: Gedatsu appears alongside the other three priests while chasing an illegal treasure hunter through Upper Yard. He explains that their time limit was up for another group of criminals.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of one of the four main antagonists of the Skypiea trials.

reveals.information: One of God Enel's four priests

keyMoments.title: Masked Warrior Attacks Priests
keyMoments.description: A masked guerrilla fighter with a bazooka appears and fires at Enel's priests near Upper Yard. Later revealed to be Wyper of the Shandia.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of the Shandia resistance and hints at the complex conflict over Upper Yard.

keyMoments.title: Wyper's Resentment Over Vearth
keyMoments.description: The masked warrior expresses resentment toward Enel over 'Vearth', revealing the underlying conflict.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the Shandia's motivation to reclaim their homeland and the precious vearth.

reveals.information: Commander of Shandia warriors fighting to reclaim Upper Yard
Resents Enel and fights for Vearth/Upper Yard

keyMoments.title: Nami Witnesses Enel's Power
keyMoments.description: While exploring Upper Yard on her Waver, Nami witnesses Enel's devastating lightning strike that obliterates a treasure hunter.
keyMoments.significance: First Straw Hat to witness Enel's terrifying power firsthand, foreshadowing the danger they face.

keyMoments.title: Nami Attacks McKinley
keyMoments.description: Furious about the massive fine, Nami impulsively drives her Waver into McKinley's face, escalating their crime status.
keyMoments.significance: Nami's hot-headed action dramatically worsens the crew's situation and forces them into conflict with the priests.

keyMoments.title: Zoro's Religious Indifference
keyMoments.description: Zoro states he doesn't care whether or not a god exists, surprising Chopper who hadn't considered that non-belief was an option.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals Zoro's secular worldview and foreshadows his willingness to challenge Enel despite his divine claims.
keyMoments.quote: I don't care whether or not a god exists.

keyMoments.title: Zoro Defeats White Berets
keyMoments.description: Zoro easily defeats the White Berets alongside Luffy and Sanji, demonstrating Blue Sea pirate superiority.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the power difference but escalates their criminal status to Class 2.

reveals.information: Zoro doesn't care whether or not a god exists
